reference.title: MDITA syntax
reference.shortdesc: As a text-based format, Markdown lacks the structure that DITA and HMTL provides.

section.p: The following table provides a quick reference to the document components that can be authored directly in MDITA.

strow.stentry:
Each definition pair uses the following format:
A line that contains the term
A second line that starts with a colon (:) and follows with the definition Each definition pair must be separated by a blank line

stentry.codeblock:
raspberry : edible fruit in the genus Rubus of the rose family
blackberry : edible fruit in the genus Rubus of the rose family

strow.stentry:
Each list item must be on a separate line and introduced by one of the following characters or character strings, followed by a space:
Period (.)
A numeral (0 - 9), followed by a period or a right parentheses

stentry.codeblock: 1. Start the application. 1. Add text to the document. 1. Save the document.

strow.stentry:
A grouping of list items. Each list item is a unit of text, preceded by one of the following characters:
Asterisk (*)
Hyphen (-)
Plus sign (+)

stentry.codeblock:
Each list item is a unit of text, preceded by one of the following characters:
- Asterisk (*) - Hyphen (-) - Plus sign (+)

strow.stentry: One or more consecutive lines of text, separated by one or more blank lines. Do not indent paragraphs with spaces or tabs.

stentry.codeblock:
This is a paragraph.
This is another paragraph. It contains line breaks, but Markdown will not convert them to hard line breaks.
